definition: to gain entry by passing an exam/to be admitted to (a college etc)
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Entrance to an elitecollege like Peking or Tsinghua University.
sentences.chinese: 爲了考進清華或者北大。

sentences.english: A: I still can't believe Mary got into college.
sentences.chinese: 我還是不敢相信瑪莉考進大學了。

sentences.english: Why don't you spank your children to enter the University of Hong Kong?
sentences.chinese: 你爲不把你的孩子打到考進香港大學？

sentences.english: But at the same time I'm extremely proud that I got in here.
sentences.chinese: 但與此同時能考進在這裏我也感到很自豪。

sentences.english: I got accepted to a collegiate institute that no one else would like to go.
sentences.chinese: 我考進了一所根本沒人想念的中專。

sentences.english: I still can't believe Mary got into college.
sentences.chinese: 我還是不敢相信瑪莉考進大學了。
